summary: This bill, the Cahokia Mounds Mississippian Culture Study Act, directs the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a special resource study of the Cahokia Mounds State Historic Site, Emerald Mounds, and Pulcher Mounds in Illinois. The study will evaluate the national significance of the area, assess the feasibility of its inclusion in the National Park System, and consider other preservation options. The Secretary must consult with relevant entities and submit a report with findings and recommendations to Congress within three years. The bill acknowledges the historical significance of the Cahokia Mounds, which represent the Mississippian culture and are designated as a National Historic Landmark, Illinois State Historic Site, and UNESCO World Heritage Site.
